daysUntilNotInfectious.name: Days until not infectious
daysUntilNotInfectious.description: The number of days it takes to lose infectiousness after starting on average.

daysUntilHospitalized.name: Days until hospitalized
daysUntilHospitalized.description: The number of days it takes to become hospitalized, if you are going to, after becoming infectious on average.

daysFromInfectedToInfectious.name: Days from infected to infectious
daysFromInfectedToInfectious.description: The number of days it takes to become infectious after being infected on average

daysToLeaveHosptialNonCritical.name: Days to leave the hospital in a non-critical case
daysToLeaveHosptialNonCritical.description: The number of days it takes to leave the hospital if you are not a critical case

pPCRNH.name: Probability of getting a positive PCR test if you are not in the hospital
pPCRNH.description: An age-adjusted probability that you get a positive PCR test if your disease is not serious enough to require hospitalization or critical care.

pPCRH.name: Probability of getting a positive PCR test if you are in the hospital or ICU,
pPCRH.description: An age-adjusted probability that you get a positive PCR test in cases that require hospitalization or critical care

daysTogoToCriticalCare.name: Days to go to critical care after arriving in the hospital
daysTogoToCriticalCare.description: The number of days it takes to go to critical care after arriving in the hospital in a serious case.

daysFromCriticalToRecoveredOrDeceased.name: Days from an ICU admission to recovery or fatality
daysFromCriticalToRecoveredOrDeceased.description: The number of days it takes on average to resolve an ICU admission on average

fractionOfCriticalDeceased.name: Fraction of ICU admissions deceased.
fractionOfCriticalDeceased.description: An age adjusted fraction of the ICU admissions that will be deceased.

importtime.name: Import Time
importtime.description: The day that COVID-19 was seeded into that state.

importlength.name: Import duration
importlength.description: Duration of the covid seeding event -- together with the initial infection impulse gets the model kicked off starting at the import time.

initialInfectionImpulse.name: Size of initial infection impulse
initialInfectionImpulse.description: Size of the initial infection impulse. The model is not very sensitive to the exact value, but it is needed in order to start the virus spreading.

pS.name: Probability of getting a mild case.
pS.description: An age-adjusted probability that you get a mild case.

pH.name: Probability of getting a case bad enough to require hospitalization.
pH.description: An age-adjusted probability that you get a case requiring hospitalization.

pC.name: Probability of getting a case bad enough to require ICU admission
pC.description: An age-adjusted probability get a severe case requiring ICU admission.

stateAdjustmentForTestingDifferences.name: State adjustment for differences in PCR / death testing and reporting.
stateAdjustmentForTestingDifferences.description: A parameter fit to adjust the time difference between PCR and fatality reporting on a state by state basis

distancePower.name: Power of the distancing function
distancePower.description: Social distancing effect on reducing susceptibility has a larger effect when densities are higher (eg the original R0 is higher). So we fit a power of the distancing function.

numberOfSimulations.name: Number of Monte Carlo simulations run
